title: Arrowhead Stadium
summary: Arrowhead Stadium is an American football stadium in Kansas City, Missouri, United States. It primarily serves as the home venue of the Kansas City Chiefs of the National Football League (NFL). The stadium is known commercially as GEHA Field at Arrowhead Stadium (pronounced G.E.H.A.), following a naming rights deal between GEHA and the Chiefs signed in March 2021.[11] The agreement began at the start of the 2021 season and ends in January 2031 with the expiration of the team's lease with the stadium's owner, the Jackson County Sports Complex Authority.[12]
